title: Large NM customer support center hiring more than 500 in Albuquerque
text: Enlarge Lowe's is hiring more than 500 for its Albuquerque call center. Lowe's Home Improvement announced on Wednesday it will be adding more than 500 jobs to its Albuquerque customer support center. Hiring will begin immediately and continue through October. Lowe's said top candidates will have computer skills and customer service experience. The positions will be full-time and responsible for customer service calls and emails, among other duties. Salaries for the positions weren't immediately revealed Wednesday. Lowe's full-time employees are eligible for a 10 percent employee discount, incentive programs, 401(k) and tuition reimbursement, among other perks, according to a press release. Enlarge Lowe's is hiring more than 500 for its Albuquerque call center. The North Carolina-based home improvement giant's Albuquerque call center opened in 2012 in the former America Online building at 6301 Jefferson St. NE. This latest hiring announcement is one of the largest since the home improvement giant said it would be adding 300 jobs to the center in 2013. Spokeswoman Sarah Lively said the increased hiring is due to an increase in customer demand. Lowe's is also hiring 386 seasonal workers this year in New Mexico, according to its website. There are more than 600 customer support employees at the center in Albuquerque now, according to Lively. Albuquerque's Lowe's call center is one of three nationwide; the others are in Indianapolis and Wilkesboro, North Carolina. Lowe's is also hiring hundreds of call center employees at those locations. According to Lowe's 2015 annual report, it had about $59 billion in net sales and has 180,000 full-time employees companywide. To learn more about the jobs, click here. Industries
